data.title: Monsieur Ibrahim
data.meta_description: Francois Dupeyron (The Machine) directed this sentimental story about a friendship between a wise old Turkish shopkeeper (Omar Sharif) and a neglected Jewish boy. Their raffish Parisian neighborhood, home to both prostitutes and petite bourgeoisie, gets a bit of added excitement when Godard and Bardot (incarnated by the scarily ageless Isabelle Adjani) show up to […]
data.text:
Review: Close Your Eyes

Spanish director Victor Erice considers the spirit of cinema itself in Close Your Eyes.

Review: The Clean Up Crew

The Clean-Up Crew is a joyous, campy heist mess.

Review: Between the Temples

With both misery and comedy, director Nathan Silver satisfyingly captures the Jewish experience.

Riverbeast alert

The Music Box Theatre will screen Don’t Let the Riverbeast Get You!, a campy cult classic by eccentric filmmaker and musician Matt Farley.

Review: Cuckoo

Cuckoo is far from perfect, but Hunter Schafer’s acting and a satisfying twist make it worth a watch.
